content.rendered:
Experienced Representation To Help You Recover From A Paralysis Injury

Few injuries change a life as drastically as paralysis. While many are aware of paraplegia and quadriplegia, there are lesser known paralysis injuries.

Understanding Lesser Known Paralysis Injuries

Foot drop is one common example. Foot drop is a type of spinal cord injury where the ability to control the foot has been diminished or lost, which causes the foot to drag.

Incomplete paralysis is another lesser known paralysis injury. Incomplete paralysis is a paralyzing injury where not all sensation or control is lost in the affected area.

Regardless of the type of paralysis you or a loved one suffered, it is evident that it’s a life-changing injury that requires adaptation. If the paralysis was the result of another’s negligence, we can help you secure compensation to meet past, present and future financial challenges.

Handling Paralysis Cases For Columbus Since 1968

At Lamkin, Van Eman, Trimble & Dougherty, LLC, our law firm has established a reputation for securing successful verdicts and settlements for injured parties since 1968. Our attorneys bring together more than 100 years of combined experience that allow us to build the highly effective cases our clients need.

Our Medical Expertise

Attorney Kathy A. Dougherty has 15 years of experience working in hospitals and clinics. Such invaluable experience helps us readily and accurately evaluate medical evidence needed to help our clients.

Contact Our Attorneys Today To Learn More

When you or a loved one has suffered a spinal cord injury, the attorneys you choose to help you recover should be skilled and experienced.

We invite you to turn to our team of experienced Ohio personal injury lawyers to find out what we can do for you and your family.

Call 614-360-2706 today. We offer free consultations and contingency fee arrangements, meaning we collect attorneys’ fees only if we recover compensation for you.
